name: Lowmarsh Hinterland
role_in_state: Food, peat and reagent supplier to coastal ports
culture_adjustments: More inland-focused kin obligations; less seafaring life
Local barter networks stronger than formal guild apprenticeships
Dialect mixes Coastal Tongues with Riveric loanwords
Peat-ritual practices blend ancestor rites with land stewardship
constraints: Seasonal road isolation during spring floods
Ritual harvest quotas enforced by coastal houses
notes: Peat pits double as ritual sites and reagent stores
Exports routed through state ports; subject to guild tariffs
